Liberal Studies
Bachelors Degree

Serving All 6 North Bay Counties At Partner Community College Campuses Near You!
 
Counties Served:
Sonoma County
	Sonoma State University
	Santa Rosa Junior College, Petaluma Campus
Marin County
	College of Marin, Kentfield & Indian Valley Campus
Napa County
	Napa Valley College
Solano County
	Solano Community College, Vallejo Center
Lake County
	Woodland Community College, Lake County Campus
Mendocino County
	Mendocino College, Lake Center

 

 



B.A. Liberal Studies Degree Completion - Saturday Hybrid (at Sonoma State University)
This hybrid program combines 4-5 Saturday seminars per semester on campus, with weekly online seminars for adults who have finished lower-division transfer coursework and whose schedules do not permit them to attend regular campus classes. Students are placed into cohorts; which builds a strong learning community and adds support throughout the program.
For more details about how to proceed, please contact:
Amy Unger
Program Coordinator and Advisor
Saturday Hybrid B.A. Liberal Studies Degree Completion Program at SSU
707-664-2601amy.unger@sonoma.edu



B.A. Liberal Studies Degree Completion
We offer an upper-division program at North Bay community colleges leading to a Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Studies. The program offers a wide variety of courses from the social sciences, humanities, and natural sciences. Courses taught by SSU faculty are scheduled evenings, weekends, and online for the working student. The major consists of 50 units of coursework in a variety of disciplines, organized into three broad areas.
For more details about how to proceed, please contact:
Amy Unger
Program Coordinator and Advisor
B.A. Liberal Studies Degree Completion Program
707-664-2601amy.unger@sonoma.edu






B.S. Business Admin Degree Completion
The program provides all upper-division requirements needed to complete a Bachelor's degree in Business with a concentration in Management.
The foundational Business Core classes give you a solid set of tools to use wherever you may be positioned, and the concentration provides the in-depth knowledge you need to move up or move on to something better.
For more details about how to proceed, please contact:
Nina Mendia
Program Coordinator and Advisor
B.S. Business Admin Degree Completion Program
707-664-2682mendian@sonoma.edu
